author: kevaundray
content: <@364458974906548225> read <@552133098075193354> summary of acde, I think the “minimal” version of portal that will be needed for 4444 will need to be able to service the same endpoints that the pre 4444 nodes are currently servicing — my understanding was that this is not the case right now with the transaction history?

author: kevaundray
content:
(Just trying to be concrete on the actual requirements here)

I guess it’s possible that if portal only supplies historical block queries and the node stores an index of tx hash to block. Then, if I get an rpc call for a tx hash, I look in the index to see what block it belongs to, then I query portal for that block

In terms of storage, it is better than status quo but in terms of bandwidth it’s not great.

Also if a node syncs from scratch they will need to s build up this tx hash to block lookup table by either querying portal or downloading it from somewhere else

author: pipermerriam
content: I would like to know how important this is for EL client teams. We can implement the necessarily support for this in a reasonably short time period (2-3 months).

author: kevaundray
content: Yeah it’s possible clients are okay with this trade off — not sure how to get signal on this question  — The point about needing to fetch a block from the network to get a single tx seems not great tbh (so I’d be surprised if most are okay with the unneeded bandwidth)
